SENT.plain: We have evaluated an infant with a striking combination of craniofacial anomalies, arachnodactyly, and severe developmental failure
She died at the age of 5 months during a recurrent apneic episode
She also had protruding eyes, downward slant of palpebral fissures, short upturned nose, midface hypoplasia, micrognathia, extreme under-development of the epiglottis, and severe feeding difficulties
The patient closely resembled four other previously reported patients
It is suggested that these five patients represent the same malformation syndrome, a well-recognizable separate entity
Our patient also had a pericentric inversion of chromosome 10; a possible association of this with the phenotype cannot be excluded
